intro: Seseli simplicifolium, commonly known as the simple-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and compound leaves that are typically divided into several linear segments. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is native to parts of Europe and western Asia. Seseli simplicifolium is often found in meadows and open woodlands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
